entry.et: Middle English weke, from Old English wicu, wucu; akin to Old High German wehha week and perhaps to Latin vicis change, alternation, Old High German wehsal exchange

def.dt: :any of a series of 7-day cycles used in various calendars
:a 7-day cycle beginning on Sunday and ending on Saturday
:a week beginning with a specified day or containing a specified holiday the week of the 18th
:a week appointed for public recognition of some cause
:a series of regular working, business, or school days during each 7-day period
:a time seven days before or after a specified day last Sunday week
:the week before Easter during which the last days of Christ's life are commemorated
:the week between Passion Sunday and Palm Sunday
